meanings.definition: To have a feeling or belief that someone is guilty of something.
meanings.sent1: She suspicioned her brother of eating the last cookie.
meanings.sent2: I suspicioned that he was lying about his whereabouts.
meanings.sent3: The cat suspicioned the dog of stealing its toy.
meanings.sent4: The detective suspicioned foul play in the mysterious case.
meanings.sent5: The teacher suspicioned cheating during the exam.

meanings.definition: To have a slight belief or idea that something is possible.
meanings.sent1: I suspicioned it might rain later in the day.
meanings.sent2: She suspicioned that the meeting would be postponed.
meanings.sent3: The child suspicioned that there were monsters under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The hiker suspicioned a hidden trail through the forest.
meanings.sent5: He suspicioned a surprise party for his birthday.
